item.title: Intelligence
item.description:
Excerpt from The Aristos (1964) by John Fowles. Taken from the section titled Inability to enact good

18 The second cause of failure to enact good stems from conflict of intention. High intelligence leads to multiplicity of interest and a sharpened capacity to foresee the consequences of any action. Will is lost in a labyrinth of hypothesis.

item.title: Key to Doing
item.description:
看到和做到是两回事，

说到和做到是两回事。

理解和做到，仍旧是两回事。

不要把它们混为一谈。

这是做到的关键。

– Unknown author

My translation

Seeing and doing are two different things.

Saying and doing are two different things.

Understanding and doing are yet two different things.

Don’t confuse them.

This is the key to doing.

item.title: Focus
item.description:
Do something only for 1 minute, focusing as hard as you can.

Then take a break.

Then try for 2 minutes.

Then take a break.

Repeat until you can focus for a long time!
